workflow.name: Custom Discord notifications for Radarr, Sonarr, Bazarr etc.
workflow.description:
This is a simple temlate that will allow you to customise the notifications in Radarr, Sonarr, Bazarr and similar. By default the notifications are configured to be sent to discord and look similar to the default ones but are just minimalistic.

All you need to configure is in your Radarr etc. instances to have Webhook notification type and here point to your Discord channel webhook.

parameters.content:
Bazarr events:
- subtitle downloaded
- subtitle upgraded

Radarr events:
- File Import
- Movie File Delete
- Movie File Delete for Upgrade
- Manual Interaction Required

Sonarr events:
- File Import
- Movie File Delete
- Movie File Delete for Upgrade
- Manual Interaction Required

### Custom Radarr / Sonarr / Bazarr notifications

If you are self hosting Radarr / Sonarr / Bazarr or similar you might want to customise the notifications. This workflow allows you to easily make them look like anything you want.

For my use case I wanted the notifications to look like the default ones but with less data (simplified). Only few event types were tested since I also did not want to have too many notifications per event. Still, it is easy to add more event types and more fields. Feel free to play around.

Configuring this workflow:
1. Change your Webhook trigger endpoint in the first node
2. Change the Discord channel Webhook URL in the last node (or use a bot if you prefer)
3. You can ignore the Evaluation triggers. I am just using them to test all notification types.


Configuring your *arr:
1. Go to Settings > Connect
2. Add Webhook connection and point it to the one you configured here (remember to use production Webhook)
3. Select File Import, Movie File Delete, Movie File Delete for Upgrade, Manual Interaction Required (Other types should also work. I just did not test them)


Note about Bazarr:
It is using ultra simple configuration compared to others. There are no event types at all. You also have to use "JSON" (there is no Webhook type) and in url use jsons instead of https like "jsons://n8n.com/webhook/radarr"

### Output
Discord format of notification.

- Title (Year) - Episode
- What happened
- Thumbnail
- Quality
- Size
- Subtitle count
- Release name

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
